Package org.pepstock.charba.client.impl.plugins

Class ChartPointerPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.plugins.AbstractPlugin
      • org.pepstock.charba.client.impl.plugins.CharbaPlugin<ChartPointerOptions>
        • org.pepstock.charba.client.impl.plugins.ChartPointerPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Plugin
    final class ChartPointerPlugin
extends CharbaPlugin<ChartPointerOptions>
    This plugin is changing the cursor when mouse over on dataset, title on canvas if a dataset selection, title handler have been defined.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero
    See Also:
    CursorType

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ChartPointerPlugin()
      To avoid any instantiation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) ChartPointerOptions createDefaultOptionInstance()
      Creates an options instance as default.
      private boolean hasDatasetSelection​(IsChart chart, NativeBaseEvent event, Set<PointerElement> scope)
      Returns true if the cursor is over to a dataset, otherwise false.
      private boolean hasLegendSelection​(IsChart chart, NativeAbstractMouseEvent event, Set<PointerElement> scope)
      Returns true if the cursor is over to the legend, otherwise false.
      private boolean hasScaleSelection​(IsChart chart, NativeAbstractMouseEvent event, Set<PointerElement> scope)
      Returns true if the cursor is over to a scale, otherwise false.
      private boolean hasSubtitleSelection​(IsChart chart, NativeAbstractMouseEvent event, Set<PointerElement> scope)
      Returns true if the cursor is over to the subtitle, otherwise false.
      private boolean hasTitleSelection​(IsChart chart, NativeAbstractMouseEvent event, Set<PointerElement> scope)
      Returns true if the cursor is over to the title, otherwise false.
      private boolean isElementInScope​(Set<PointerElement> scope, PointerElement element)
      Returns true if the element is configured in order to apply cursor when mouse is over.
      void onAfterEvent​(IsChart chart, PluginEventArgument argument)
      Called after the 'event' has been consumed.
      Note that this hook will not be called if the 'event' has been previously discarded.
      void onBeforeDestroy​(IsChart chart)
      Called before the chart is being destroyed.
      boolean onBeforeUpdate​(IsChart chart, PluginUpdateArgument argument)
      Called before updating 'chart'.
      If any plugin returns false, the update is cancelled (and thus subsequent render(s)) until another 'update' is triggered.

      • onBeforeUpdate

        public boolean onBeforeUpdate​(IsChart chart,
                              PluginUpdateArgument argument)
        Description copied from interface: Plugin
        Called before updating 'chart'.
        If any plugin returns false, the update is cancelled (and thus subsequent render(s)) until another 'update' is triggered.
        Parameters:
        chart - the chart instance.
        argument - the argument passed for update
        Returns:
        false to cancel the chart update.

      • onAfterEvent

        public void onAfterEvent​(IsChart chart,
                         PluginEventArgument argument)
        Description copied from interface: Plugin
        Called after the 'event' has been consumed.
        Note that this hook will not be called if the 'event' has been previously discarded.
        Parameters:
        chart - the chart instance.
        argument - instance which contains event context

      • isElementInScope

        private boolean isElementInScope​(Set<PointerElement> scope,
                                 PointerElement element)
        Returns true if the element is configured in order to apply cursor when mouse is over.
        Parameters:
        scope - list of pointer elements configured as in scope
        element - the element to be checked
